items.sentence: I thought that you said Tom used to live in Australia.
I thought that you'd want to go to Australia with Tom.
Tom and Mary both lived in Boston when they were kids.
I thought that you wanted to go to the party with Tom.
I thought that you were going to go shopping with Tom.
I thought that you were going to quit working for Tom.
I thought that you weren't supposed to be helping Tom.
I thought that something was seriously wrong with Tom.
I thought that I was the only one who didn't like Tom.
I thought that I'd have another chance to talk to Tom.
Tom thinks that he left his French textbook at Mary's.
Tom said he didn't think that Mary could speak French.
The last time that I went to Australia, I visited Tom.
It's hard to believe Tom really wants to go to Boston.
Do you remember the first time that you talked to Tom?
I didn't think that anybody suspected you weren't Tom.
Tom didn't stay in Boston for as long as he wanted to.
I hope that you and Tom have a good time in Australia.
I didn't know Tom and Mary went to Australia together.
How did you learn that Tom wasn't living in Australia?
Do you think that Tom knows I want to go to Australia?
I didn't think Tom would be in Australia last weekend.
What's the best birthday present you've ever received?
What's the best advice that anyone has ever given you?
You're going the wrong way. You've got to turn around.
We had an opportunity to change things, but we didn't.
When everything's ready, let's put a sign on the door.
Tom wants you to know that he really wants to do that.
I make it a rule not to speak French in the classroom.
The plot was so complicated that I couldn't follow it.
I think I already know what you're going to say to me.
You're right. The noodle soup is a bit expensive here.
I don't think Tom knows what kind of music Mary likes.
I don't think it's very likely Tom will be here today.
I don't think that Tom would help me with my homework.
I don't think Tom will be as picky as Mary usually is.
I don't think that this is a good time to talk to Tom.
I don't think that it would be wise to argue with Tom.
I don't think that Tom knows how to speak French well.
I don't think that Tom is going to be here until 2:30.
I don't think that Tom did anything about the problem.
I don't think that Tom and Mary recognized each other.
I don't think anybody would consider Tom good-looking.
I don't think I'd be able to get Tom to do that again.
I don't think I should borrow any more money from Tom.
I didn't really feel like doing what I was told to do.
I had no idea that Tom could speak French so fluently.
I'm indeed grateful for everything you've done for us.
I liked Mary, not for her looks, but for her kindness.
Mary's nerves caused her to mess up her job interview.
